    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      AlarmClock()
      Constructor for AlarmClock object, which sets the current time and alarm time to 12 AM while also setting the alarm to off.

      Constructor for AlarmClock object, which sets the current time and alarm time based on parameters while also setting the alarm to on or off based on parameters

    • Constructor Detail

      • AlarmClock

        public AlarmClock()
        Constructor for AlarmClock object, which sets the current time and alarm time to 12 AM while also setting the alarm to off.

      • AlarmClock

        public AlarmClock​(int hour,
                  int minutes,
                  java.lang.String period,
                  int alarmHour,
                  int alarmMinute,
                  java.lang.String alarmPeriod,
                  boolean set)
        Constructor for AlarmClock object, which sets the current time and alarm time based on parameters while also setting the alarm to on or off based on parameters
        Parameters:
        hour - The hour at which the clock is set to. Valid hours are integers from 1 to 12, otherwise it doesn't change.
        minute - The minute at which the clock is set to. Valid minutes are integers from 0 to 59, otherwise it doesn't change.
        period - The period at which the clock is set to. Valid periods are "a.m." or "p.m.," otherwise it defaults to "a.m."
        alarmHour - The hour at which the alarm is set to. Valid hours are integers from 1 to 12, otherwise it doesn't change.
        alarmMinute - The minute at which the alarm is set to. Valid minutes are integers from 0 to 59, otherwise it doesn't change.
        alarmPeriod - The period at which the alarm is set to. Valid periods are "a.m." or "p.m.," otherwise it defaults to "a.m."
        set - Indicates whether the alarm is turned on or not.

    • Method Detail

      • setTime

        public void setTime​(int hour,
                    int minutes,
                    java.lang.String period)
        Sets the time of the clock.
        Parameters:
        hour - The hour at which the clock is set to. Valid hours are integers from 1 to 12, otherwise it doesn't change.
        minute - The minute at which the clock is set to. Valid minutes are integers from 0 to 59, otherwise it doesn't change.
        period - The period at which the clock is set to. Valid periods are "a.m." or "p.m.," otherwise it defaults to "a.m."

      • setAlarmTime

        public void setAlarmTime​(int hour,
                         int minutes,
                         java.lang.String period)
        Sets the time at which the alarm should go off
        Parameters:
        hour - The hour at which the alarm is set to. Valid hours are integers from 1 to 12, otherwise it doesn't change.
        minute - The minute at which the alarm is set to. Valid minutes are integers from 0 to 59, otherwise it doesn't change.
        period - The period at which the alarm is set to. Valid periods are "a.m." or "p.m.," otherwise it defaults to "a.m."

      • clockTick

        public void clockTick()
        This method should get called once every minute - it makes the clock display go one minute forward. If the clock time matches the alarm time and the alarm is set, the alarm rings and is automatically turned off (will have to be re-set).

      • setAlarm

        public void setAlarm()
        Turns on Alarm

      • unsetAlarm

        public void unsetAlarm()
        Turns off Alarm

      • getTime

        public java.lang.String getTime()
        Return the current time of the clock in the format HH:MMperiod.
        Returns:
        Returns a string of the form HH:MMperiod, ex: "12:00a.m."

      • getAlarmTime

        public java.lang.String getAlarmTime()
        Returns the time the alarm is set to go off in the format HH:MMperiod
        Returns:
        Returns a string of the form HH:MMperiod, ex: "12:00a.m."

      • isAlarmSet

        public boolean isAlarmSet()
        Return whether or not the alarm is set
        Returns:
        Returns a boolean value representing whether or not the alarm is set.
